This commit is to add meson build.

I'm slightly perplexed by the existence of this script without any usage of it.  Does this repository need to generate bindings or not?  If not, delete this.  If so, where are the resulting meson files?
I'll let @Matt weigh in, but this seems like a whole lot of overhead for an "example".  We supply the contents from P-D-I now, so why bother?  Can we just clean the example out?
hmm, i'm not entirely certain what this is for.... George?

> We supply the contents from P-D-I now, so why bother?  Can we just clean the example out?

Yes, I agree with you, I just made a parallel switching meson.
Adding these interfaces is only used in test/test.cpp, and this test.cpp does not do UT, so I think we can remove it.
@Matt, @Patrick, What do you think?


> hmm, i'm not entirely certain what this is for.... George?

The previous logic is that a binary will be compiled in test/test.cpp, but it is not installed to the image, so I am not sure what use this binary will have. My current understanding is that it can be deleted. I would like to ask your opinions.
I don't have any problem with it being removed.  I don't think anyone is supplying custom YAML anymore.

> I don't have any problem with it being removed.  I don't think anyone is supplying custom YAML anymore.

Sure, I agree with you, will update it
Is there anything from 'example' that should be removed now?  I can't tell if it is used just as documentation.  Maybe a follow up commit?

> Is there anything from 'example' that should be removed now?  I can't tell if it is used just as documentation.  Maybe a follow up commit?

Yes, I have pushed a new commit here:
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-inventory-manager/+/53682

cppfs is not used anymore.  Please remove this while you're at it.

(It hasn't been needed since C++17)
These are why I suggested you needed these specified in the wrapfile.
Absolutely not.  Do not do this in a meson build.
Please move all this to the top where you're finding the other dependencies.
Don't you need a `libmanagercommon_dep += nlohmann_json_dep` here?  I don't see this dependency being used anywhere.

> Don't you need a `libmanagercommon_dep += nlohmann_json_dep` here?  I don't see this dependency being used anywhere.

Yes, you are right, Added
Please 'enabled' by default.  Everyone uses this, right?  Generally we want to enable all options in meson so they get built in CI.
Do we need a default path here for testing?

> Do we need a default path here for testing?

I referenced configure.ac, and didn't find any assignment to it
We've discussed these options elsewhere now.  I think you've especially resolved this one as you're now using the pkgconfig variable from P-D-I as the default.
Should the removes be put into the "remove autotools" commit?
Do we really care about the excess warnings when building in Yocto?  Can we just drop this?  I don't see it in the original autotools implementation.
Are you intentionally overwriting `generated_cpp` from line 93?  Should this be +=?

> Are you intentionally overwriting `generated_cpp` from line 93?  Should this be +=?

Nope, This is a duplicate of line 79, and I think lines 77-89 can be removed, we don't use these

In addition, if the example file mentioned earlier can be deleted, it will also be removed synchronously here
Delete still seems to be at the wrong place in the stack.

Oops, it is my mistake 😞
Done
Something isn't right with these since the default is empty.  I think we need to be able to point at the YAMLs provided by the phosphor-dbus-interfaces dep, right?
This seems silly.  Can't you default to this in the meson_options rather than coding in the meson.build itself?
I get why we have to do this one here.
Have you tried this yet with bitbake to see if it processes the inventory-cleanup.yaml that meta-ibm uses?

> Have you tried this yet with bitbake to see if it processes the inventory-cleanup.yaml that meta-ibm uses?

Oops, I tested it again and found that there is a problem with it processes the inventory-cleanup.yaml
Let me check it agian and fix it

> > Have you tried this yet with bitbake to see if it processes the inventory-cleanup.yaml that meta-ibm uses?
> 
> Oops, I tested it again and found that there is a problem with it processes the inventory-cleanup.yaml
> Let me check it agian and fix it

I tested it again, this commit test works fine when the following patch is applied,  
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/53902

Since the code uses 
#ifdef CREATE_ASSOCIATIONS

and not #if CREATE_ASSOCIATIONS

what is CREATE_ASSOCIATIONS when it's off, '0'?  That would still bring in the code right?

> Since the code uses 
> #ifdef CREATE_ASSOCIATIONS
> 
> and not #if CREATE_ASSOCIATIONS
> 
> what is CREATE_ASSOCIATIONS when it's off, '0'?  That would still bring in the code right?

No, associations defined in meson_options.txt is a feature
if we change associations to `diabled`, it doesn't bring code
